guide.introduction:
I had intended to simply mount a number of binding posts, an led and switch into an ATX power supply as with a number of guides available on the internet, however the power supplies I have available are PC Power and Cooling, a high-end manufacturer, and they literally have NO room inside to mount anything else. Sparkfun has a kit, but it's made for an ATX 2.x (24 pin) supply and has no -5vdc output. Mystic Electronics has a pre-made board for a 20 pin supply but again, it has no -5vdc post, plus I have no use for the j-hook points it includes and I didn't feel like paying $30 for it. Hence, this project.

Warning:

Line voltage can kill (anything above 30 milliamps/volts can kill you in a matter of time if it somehow penetrates your skin), and at the very least give you a painful shock. Make sure that you have removed the power cord before doing the conversion and have discharged the capacitors as described in the steps below.
